lede: An economy or economic system consists of the production, distribution, consumption and trade of limited goods and services by different agents in a given geographical location. The economic agents can be individuals, businesses, organisations, or governments.
name: Economy

sections.name: Inflation and price indices
sections.description: The Consumer Prices Index, the Retail Price Index and other statistics measure changes and trends in the UK economy.

sections.name: Gross Domestic Product (GDP)
sections.description: The value of all finished goods and services produced in the UK in a specific time period.

sections.name: Government, public sector and taxes
sections.description: Revenue and spending in the public sector and research and development.

sections.name: Economic output and productivity
sections.description: Statistics on the output of sectors including production, manufacturing, agriculture, forestry and fishing and others.

sections.name: Regional accounts
sections.description: Breakdown of Gross Disposable Household Income by regions of the UK.

sections.name: Gross Value Added (GVA)
sections.description: Measures the contribution to the economy of each individual producer, industry or sector. Breakdown by region.

sections.name: National Accounts
sections.description: The UK's Balance of Payments, calculated from imports, exports and other transactions.

sections.name: Environmental accounts
sections.description: Assessments of the UK's impact on the environment, including total energy consumption and greenhouse gas emissions.

sections.name: Investments, pensions and trusts
sections.description: Net investment flows into the UK and investment abroad by UK companies.
